title: What is your opinion of the first presidential debate 2020? - Quora
tags: Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Despite what the MSM might try and tell you, the mighty Trumpster emerged from the first debate a clear winner. Indeed it was so great that immediately after the final bell Trump was the recipient of a flurry of awards. most interruption in a single debate - Often accelerating to speeds of over 60 interruptions per hour, Trump cruised past the record he set himself back in 2016. Even the moderator, who seemed to be dwelling under the strange belief that he was meant to ask questions, was no match Donny’s endless stream intertrumptions. In this way, he successfully prevented the watching audience from learning anything about anything. Now that’s democracy in action. Best newcomer award - Bit of a surprise here given that Donny boy is the sitting president. However, the committee decided that since he behaved like a ill-tempered three-year-old he really had to rated along side other toddlers and who could doubt that this was the single best presidential debate performance by an under 5? KKK lifetime award - Obviously this has been coming for a while, but the “KKK seal of approval” Trumpster finally hit legend status with his unflinching support for white supremacy. Just when Biden thought he had him cornered into having to condemn white supremacists, the Trumpy one turned it around by using the platform to issue a call to arms to gun-totting, far-right crazies everywhere. Stand by and (presumably) prepare for the night of the long knives part 2 - doesn’t get more presidential than that. Winner - worst presidential candidate ever - And so the big gong of the night also went to the mighty Trump - was there really ever any doubt? In all honesty have you ever seen a more complete package of dishonesty, complete lack of personal integrity, abject lack of intelligence, complete incompetence and total detachment from reality? Trump is probably the worst political candidate anywhere since Count Dracula ran for Romanian presidency under the slogan “I am of your blood, or at least I will be once I’ve drunk it”. As Donny boy has said before the winning just never stops with the Trumpster. But where there are winners, there also have to be losers and the big loser in yesterday’s debate was American democracy, which took a 90-minute long pounding. Indeed, shortly after the debate ended, the Statue of Liberty, claiming intolerable stress, resigned her position and emigrated to New Zealand. Some say things couldn’t get worse - but then we still have the 2nd and 3rd debates to come!

To be perfectly honest, I thought it was a fucking mess. For the sake of not being attacked in the comments, I’m gonna leave my own personal political opinions out of it and just objectively describe what I thought. And I thought it was bad.  I’d like to start with that I feel bad for Chris. I’d never seen a moderator in a debate get disrespected like that, by both parties but mainly Trump. Both of them constantly kept talking over each other and Chris and it wasn’t easy to make out the points they were making.  About ten seconds into his first two-minute segment, Joe Biden looked like he was completely lost. Stumbling his words, constantly reading notes without discreetness, and going directly into the camera with those “Puss in Boots” please vote for me please eyes.  At the other end of the room, Trump decided that he was gonna talk when he felt like it. There were so many interruptions that it wasn’t entertaining or even tolerable, it was just distracting. Sorry Chris, this is my debate. But besides the blabbering over each other and the swift avoidance of many hot topics, the things they actually said felt more like a sketch than an actual debate. Some highlights: (not quoting, just paraphrasing) Trump: You guys ever heard of insulin? It’s been tearing families apart because of the cost, but now insulin is like water. - Biden: He panicked, and a lot more people are gonna die if he doesn’t get a lot smarter Trump: Smarter? Don’t use that word with me, Joe. You couldn’t even remember the name of your college. Worst in your class. Never use that word again. - Wallace: Mr. Vice President, how do you feel about masks? Biden: The thing about opening a business is, you always, always, have to have a plan. Wallace: I was asking about masks Biden: Oh yeah, yeah they’re good. - Wallace: As the moderator, I set the rules and Mr. President your party agreed to two minutes of uninterrupted time. So please stop interrupting nobody wants you to do that. Trump: Yeah but, he’s interrupting too. Wallace: You’re interrupting more, now stop talking. - Trump: I have done more for black people than any other president in the history of this country. Well except maybe Abraham Lincoln. - Wallace: Do you denounce white supremacists, neo-nazis, proud boys, etc. Trump: Sure, what do you want me to call them? Wallace: Moving on to our next topic Media the next morning: “TRUMP ENDORSES WHITE SUPREMACY” - Every goddamn time Trump told us that Hunter Biden got 3 million from the mayor of Moscow I think Biden wanted to get up and swing at him. - Biden: The Green New Deal is gonna pay for itself Trump: It’s gonna cost like 100 trillion dollars Wallace: Oh so Mr. Vice President, you support the Green New Deal? Biden: No of course not, I’m talking about the Biden Plan duh - Wallace: Do you think there is systemic racism in law enforcement? Biden: Yes there is systemic racism. All cops are good, except for a few bad apples. excuse me? I don’t think Biden knows the definition of the word “systemic” - I think that both of them have some things to improve on for the next one. Donald, stop being such a dick. Like I get it, be aggressive and throw Biden off his game but for God’s sake stop arguing with the moderator. It’s unpresidential and unwarranted and it makes you look rather immature. No matter how good (or bad) your message is, no one’s gonna hear it if you yell it over the moderator. Biden is going to slip on facts so just let him. Joe, rise above. We all knew Donald was gonna get mean and personal, that’s to be expected. But you should be the alternative. Be mature if your opponent wants to be a child. Don’t be a bigger child and call him an idiot, or a clown. It makes you look like those things. Once someone goes to personal insults, it means they don’t have the ammo to win the argument with logic. - It wasn’t fun watching this debate knowing other countries are probably laughing at us. Quite honestly it felt like a bad Saturday Night Live sketch I would change the channel on. Hopefully, the next one is more organized, more civil, and hopefully, they’ll actually answer most of the questions. Until then, I guess all we can do is laugh along. thanks for the reads homies
